c9ebaa3a-7edd-4523-a9d0-a32156e09e57.description: Earners of the Unity College “21st Century Skills and Career Readiness” badge have demonstrated that they can utilize the professional skills required to synthesize information and be an effective collaborator: active listening, project management, incorporating diverse perspectives, anticipating challenges and being solutions-oriented.
c9ebaa3a-7edd-4523-a9d0-a32156e09e57.name: 21st Century Skills and Career Readiness Badge

badge_template_activities.title: GRIT and Goal setting. Students examine contemporary scholarship around mindset and approaches to success, then draft two goals and corresponding plans to realize them. This process transfers to workplace tasks with both long-term and short-term timelines. Students must earn 75% or higher.

Time Management Techniques. Students evaluate multiple time management techniques, then select two to implement, ultimately deciding which works best for them. This process emphasizes experimenting, evidence gathering, comparing, and decision making. Students can apply both the implementation of a time management technique for efficiency as well as the evaluation process. Students must earn 75% or higher.

Receiving and working with feedback. Students enter the “feedback loop” to familiarize themselves with the process of giving, receiving, and working with feedback. This assessment emphasizes clear communication as well as active listening and engagement. By outfitting students with the capacity to absorb and implement feedback, this activity prepares them for authentic experiences in their professional lives. Students must earn 75% or higher.

Appreciative inquiry - problem solving technique. This assessment employs a mini experiment design, execution, and reflection in order to equip students with the skill of appreciative inquiry. Students identify a scenario with a problem, then devise how they will approach it while engaging in the process of appreciative inquiry. Students then create a brief video recounting the process and how they can continue to draw on this skill. Students must earn 75% or higher.

Leadership and Professional Development. Students practice the “High Quality Connections” (HQC) Technique in another mini-experiment. They create a video explaining the design, process, and application of this technique, emphasizing their communication skills. Students then revise their LinkedIn and Handshake profiles to reflect their newly developed skills. Students must earn 75% or higher.

Integrity and Plagiarism. After reading “Managing Interpersonal Feedback,” students write an executive summary of the article and synthesize the author’s main points. Students practice incorporating an author’s concepts and quotes into their own work, which demonstrates key critical writing and analytical skills. Students must earn 75% or higher.

e7a1b05c-5ab9-4e39-a930-c4d57ef8e269.description: Earners of the Unity College “Career Readiness: Preparing for the Workplace” badge have demonstrated that they can identify the professional skills required to be a successful job candidate such as creating a LinkedIn profile, creating cover letters and resumes for a specific professional audience, and developing a professional network.
e7a1b05c-5ab9-4e39-a930-c4d57ef8e269.name: Career Readiness: Preparing for the Workplace

badge_template_activities.title: Completed Week 2 Assessment: Created a LinkedIn Profile.
Completed Week 2 Assessment: Created Resume and Cover Letter to use for jobs and internships
Completed Week 2 Assessment: Interviewed a Working Professional to reflect on their chosen profession

0a3ef198-6887-4c2a-a926-79ba393ff175.description: In an Animal Behavior Lab Practical, learners will observe videos of animals learning new behaviors. They must analyze the animal’s behavior to select how the behavior has changed in frequency and identify learning principles such as classical and operant conditioning. Learners must recognize training tools and identify reinforcers utilized. An assessment highlights their ability to discriminate between learning principles and assess their understanding of applied behavior analysis.
0a3ef198-6887-4c2a-a926-79ba393ff175.name: Analyzing Animal Behavior

badge_template_activities.title: Learners will be awarded this badge upon passing the Animal Behavior Lab Practical with a score of 80% or better. By earning a minimum score of 80%, earners of this badge have demonstrated that they can identify principles of animal learning including classical and operant conditioning, basic behavior modification, and recognize training tools to guide animal behavior and promote minimal handling and proper animal welfare.

ca6c66bb-d6d1-4421-b0d2-47cf7ba47f66.description: Earners have shown that they can employ the tools and techniques of narrative craft to advocate on behalf of environmental issues. Students build on skills to tell effective stories and then employ those skills to tell an effective, affecting story or collection of stories about environmental issues. Stories are an effective medium for conveying understanding of the scope and stakes of environmental issues, and giving voice to the science that cannot speak for itself.
ca6c66bb-d6d1-4421-b0d2-47cf7ba47f66.name: Advocacy through Creative Storytelling

badge_template_activities.title: Students will be awarded this badge in ARTS 105 upon achieving a 75% or above on the following assignments: Week 1 Course Project Step 1: Story Pitches Student pitches multiple story ideas, and practices connecting those ideas to environmental issues, then intentionally planning for how to tell those stories in order to address those issues.

Students will be awarded this badge in ARTS 105 upon achieving a 75% or above on the following assignments: Week 2 Course Project Step 2: Story Structure Student plans structure of narrative in order to make it as engaging and effective as possible.

Students will be awarded this badge in ARTS 105 upon achieving a 75% or above on the following assignments: Week 3 Course Project Step 3: Drafting Student analyzes the line-level texture of their narrative to evaluate how effective and engaging it is; practice for establishing distance from their own creations in order to better iterate them.

Students will be awarded this badge in ARTS 105 upon achieving a 75% or above on the following assignments: The Workshop:  Students work in groups to practice evaluating each other’s work for how effective it is as a piece of art and for how effective it is at accomplishing the advocacy the student plans. Discussing Places of Publication: Students discuss different options for publication of their pieces, evaluating each option for how effective it will be for reaching target audiences.

Students will be awarded this badge in ARTS 105 upon achieving a 75% or above on the following assignments: Week 5 Course Project Step 6: Plan for Publication Students plan how they will go about getting their own work(s) published.

536083c8-1bff-4d2b-8a11-3cce38c94382.description: The StoryMap is an ESRI ArcGIS Web Application that students build as a professional step into the Geographic Information Systems (GIS) world. Students build the application by inserting images, maps, and writing descriptive text and captions to both tell a story about their professional experiences and to analyze the scientific methods of a GIS-based research project. StoryMaps help students build basic GIS skills, such as basic cartography, editing maps online, and describing geospatial data.
536083c8-1bff-4d2b-8a11-3cce38c94382.name: GIS StoryMap

badge_template_activities.title: GeoCV StoryMap: Students will follow a tutorial and then create their own map-based resume or curriculum vitae. This is a project that students may continue to build upon throughout their future GIS career. Students are encouraged to share their GeoCV with prospective employers to highlight their mapping and data visualization skills.

Final Project StoryMap: Students analyze a GIS-based research paper and summarize the research in StoryMap format. Students incorporate text, maps, photos, graphs, and videos to help tell the environmental geospatial story of the peer-reviewed study. Each week students build upon this StoryMap, which culminates in the final week when they share the web link with the GIS community at large.

40bca9fb-5988-41f2-95e0-6b7311c5139b.description: Earners of the Introduction to eXtended Reality (XR) Badge can describe the full spectrum of XR technology including augmented reality, mixed reality, and virtual reality. They can identify the tools used to create immersive experiences and are able to articulate effective and innovative uses in a wide range of fields and applications.
40bca9fb-5988-41f2-95e0-6b7311c5139b.name: Introduction to eXtended Reality (XR) Badge

badge_template_activities.title: Completion of relevant self-paced unfacilitated coursework including: Complete learning units, viewing and interacting with all media, completing the end-of-course survey.

c855fc88-8d72-4f0e-9c6b-e5388fb96c52.description: The earner of this badge has participated in a competitive virtual hackathon hosted by Unity College’s Unity Innovation lab. Teams utilized MetaVRse and other VR related authoring and publishing tools, data visualization and variety of other techniques applied to an environmental problem that takes full advantage of the affordances of extended reality technologies. Sponsored by Unity College and Unity Innovation lab in collaboration with Yale, U of Michigan, Quinnipiac University, and MetaVRse.
c855fc88-8d72-4f0e-9c6b-e5388fb96c52.name: XR EcoHack 2020

badge_template_activities.title: Complete survey upon completion of XR EcoHack 2020

7144d8fd-ee73-4adf-9d8d-b1f53f0a71e1.description: Earners of the Unity College Sustainable Business Plan badge have demonstrated that they can identify essential business and management skills required to be a successful entrepreneur, identify a sustainable business niche after conducting market research, create an origin story, conduct and evaluate industry research, create a basic business plan with cost and revenue projections, and present business concepts and receive feedback on them.
7144d8fd-ee73-4adf-9d8d-b1f53f0a71e1.name: Sustainable Business Plan

badge_template_activities.title: Completed Week 1 Assessments: Developed a Business Idea and Completed a Business Overview with a Service Offering Summary.
Completed Week 2 Assessments: Performed a Market Analysis and Drafted a Business Management Plan.
Completed Week 3 Assessment:  Developed a Financial Plan for a Sustainable Small Business.
Completed Week 4 Assessment:  Developed a Sustainability Statement and Plan for a Sustainable Small Business.
Completed Week 5 Assessments: Developed a Marketing and Sales  Plan for a Sustainable Small Business.
Final Summative Project: Developed a Complete Sustainable Small Business Proposal.

f89b228b-f38f-4001-bebe-cf97f01a9569.description: Students will learn field data collection techniques, assumptions, and challenges to generating population estimates of wildlife using distance sampling. They interact with the Virtual Forest Simulation to practice field components of distance sampling and participate in two discussions on challenges and assumptions of this technique and its current uses in the wildlife discipline. Successful learners will be capable of collecting field data for this approach.
f89b228b-f38f-4001-bebe-cf97f01a9569.name: Distance Sampling

badge_template_activities.title: Students will evaluate the impact of detectability on population estimates and explore the challenges created by animal and observer behavior and environmental complexity on estimating populations of unmarked animals.  By earning a score of 80% or higher, students demonstrate a basic understanding of the challenges in effectively performing distance sampling in the field.

Students will practice distance and angle estimation and discuss the impact of violation of assumptions of distance sampling that occur from field practices on the resulting population estimates.  By earning a score of 80% or higher, students will demonstrate an understanding of the field basics of this method, as well as the results of their practice of the key field aspects of this method.

caf3cc1d-95a3-4d63-9381-9b180b28ff77.description: Badge earners can answer the question “Who bears the burden and why?” as it relates to various marginalized groups, their disproportionate proximity to climate-change induced natural disasters and their access to oceans and ocean-based resources. They can explain prevalent concepts such as ocean justice, climate justice, environmental justice, race, gender identity, and sexuality. They can discuss the intersecting nature of ocean justice issues, their historical contexts, and possible solutions.
caf3cc1d-95a3-4d63-9381-9b180b28ff77.name: Ocean Justice

badge_template_activities.title: Earn at least 6 points (out of a possible 10) in their final reflection in the Ocean Justice course.

0fab5e82-afed-4105-b5f0-60a966eaff82.description: Learners will define a marketing persona for a VR experience they intend to design, then craft a storyboard for their VR experience with that persona in mind. The persona and storyboard together comprise a standard design process, of defining a target audience for a product and then drafting early ideations of that product, using established protocols of design. Successful learners have shown that they know and can apply foundational principles of VR design.
0fab5e82-afed-4105-b5f0-60a966eaff82.name: Virtual Reality Design

badge_template_activities.title: Persona and Planned VR Experience. Students must include a fictional photograph, drawing, or figure representing a person. This description must include a name, details about this person that others working on your planned VR experience would need. Students demonstrate that they can create a persona to effectively define a target user and create a clearly defined plan for a storyboard, including details on sound and movement.

Storyboard. Using a VR wireframe template and using a drawing technology of choice, sketch the six narrative plot points: Introduction, Set the Scene, Dilemma, Crisis, Change, and Resolution. Students demonstrate that they can address all the plot points, and together provide a sketch of the narrative arc of the planned VR experience, making use of layout, providing visual indicators of what is where, and how the orientation of these entities in space comprises a meaningful experience.

eb5ed4ca-3716-499d-9a9a-2980396eeb9b.description: Successful badge recipients will be able to apply and evaluate project plans involving these leadership attributes: Situational Awareness Agility: Learning, Change, Tactical & Strategic Action Clear Communications Prioritization Resiliency Participants are outfitted with tools they can immediately implement to create positive change and make a lasting impact in the workplace. Furthermore, they are more informed, decisive, and collaborative thanks to the variety of activities and resources.
eb5ed4ca-3716-499d-9a9a-2980396eeb9b.name: @TheHelm (Advanced)

badge_template_activities.title: Badge earners have demonstrated an ability to apply, and then evaluate, revise and improve, plans for leading change within and across teams.

0f493238-94f3-46af-9703-b186d746c1ce.description: Successful badge recipients will be able to describe and identify the following leadership attributes: Situational Awareness Agility: Learning, Change, Tactical & Strategic Action Clear Communications Prioritization Resiliency By earning the badge, participants explore tools they can work to implement to create positive change and make a lasting impact in the workplace.
0f493238-94f3-46af-9703-b186d746c1ce.name: @TheHelm (Foundational)

badge_template_activities.title: Badge earners have shown they can identify and describe the concepts and terms associated with the following: Situational Awareness Agility: Learning, Change, Tactical & Strategic Action Clear Communications Prioritization Resiliency

4c95d0af-b215-4afa-8998-42fdfd781749.description: Successful badge recipients will be able to discuss and apply the following leadership attributes: Situational Awareness Agility: Learning, Change, Tactical & Strategic Action Clear Communications Prioritization Resiliency By earning the badge, participants are outfitted with tools they can immediately implement to create positive change and make a lasting impact in the workplace. Furthermore, they're more informed, decisive, and collaborative thanks to the variety of activities and resources.
4c95d0af-b215-4afa-8998-42fdfd781749.name: @TheHelm (Intermediate)

badge_template_activities.title: Badge earners have shown they are able to discuss and apply the following concepts, tools and terms in regards to leadership practice: Situational Awareness Agility: Learning, Change, Tactical & Strategic Action Clear Communications Prioritization Resiliency

57a08c5b-5375-44a5-a245-4c39060fce65.description: Earners of the XR Authoring Using Amazon Sumerian Badge can create immersive and interactive three-dimensional experiences for a wide variety of use cases. Earners are able to rapidly prototype and publish web-based VR/AR applications that can be accessed via a web URL in a browser as well as a variety of AR/VR hardware.
57a08c5b-5375-44a5-a245-4c39060fce65.name: XR Authoring Using Amazon Sumerian

badge_template_activities.title: Published 3D simulation prototype to showcase to potential employers.  Tasks include: Create a scene and import 3D assets, Add and configure entities, Configure state machine behaviors, Distribute your scene globally in seconds using a public URL

2c7b95c3-627b-4fa2-b0e8-f7d2db8a4ae8.description: After participating in this bootcamp, students will be able to identify the fundamentals of effective, innovative XR applications. First, the course will familiarize them with the full spectrum of XR technologies including augmented reality, mixed reality, and virtual reality. Then it will show them how those XR experiences are created. Finally, students will be invited to design and showcase an original XR solution applied to their own field of study. See page 3 for additional details
2c7b95c3-627b-4fa2-b0e8-f7d2db8a4ae8.name: XR Bootcamp

badge_template_activities.title: Completion of the Asynchronous and Synchronous section of the XR Bootcamp: Describe the full spectrum of XR technology including augmented reality, mixed reality, and virtual reality. Identify the tools and processes used to create XR experiences. Articulate effective and innovative XR solutions to solve problems in a range of fields.
